Name: Subramomiam Jeeva
Comment: XUV 300 is the best in this segment. I had the test drive for both cars at the same day with 10 minutes gap. Nexon has blaind spot in the right A pillar, it has big cabin noice, and a lot of body roll. Even clutch is also harder than XUV 300. But in XUV 300 is far better in all the above. No cabin noice, very less almost no body roll, very easy light clutch. Very fun to drive. More safer then Nexon because of all wheal disc brake and 6 air bags. The 17" allay wheel give you more stable and confident drive. Besides XUV is heavier than Nexon. XUV300 is the best in this segment. Go for XUV 300. It has fun to drive strong punchy diesel engine. After a test drive with Nexon,Kia Seltos I purchased XUV 300W8(O) last week.

Name: Saurabh Sood
Comment:
Fact about Kia/ Hyundai:
The Global NCAP cars sold in other countries and similar looking car sold in India are Slightly different platform.
Indian people are given a Sub- Standard version of the vehicle which are fitted with bells and whistles.
Kia Seltos
Worldwide platform: P2
Indian platform : P2i
Difference:
Ultra high strength steel in Global platform is switched by high strength steel which is a cheaper low quality variety.
Kia and Hyundai share the same platforms in India.
So 
It could be true for your Hyundai car as well.
TATA motors are transparent and they clearly advertise their platform.
Before buying that fancy Hyundai/ Kia, 
Do take time to check the facts.

Comment:
SUB COMPACT SUVs - My prefrence list 
1) Tata nexon (Safety and Comfort)
2) Ford ecosports (Ride and handling)
3) XUV300 (Safety, comfort, Ride and handelling but needs better cabin and lacks boot space and ground clearance)
4) Hyundai Venue (4* safety and best in class features)
5) Sonet (Looks and features)
6) Brezza/Urban cruiser (4* and maruti service network)
7) Renault Kiger
8) Magnite

First of all amazing review. It helped me a lot make up my mind and I am damn sure, it would have helped tons of people. Power to motoroctane. 😎

Comment:
अगर आप kia Sonet के GT line के अलावा कोई भी और model लेने जा रहे है तो ये पोस्ट आपके लिए है!!

दोस्तों ज़रूर kia की ये गाड़ी sonet आपको बहुत लुभावनी लग रही है और क्यों ना लगे १३ लाख में बहुत फ़ीचर kia आपको ऑफ़र कर रही है लेकिन क्या यही सचाई है अगर नहीं तो कैसे 

Kia ने अपनी GT लाइन के नीचे के models में लुभावने features तो कई दिए है मगर सुरक्षा विशेषताओं को अनदेखा किया है इसमें बुनियादी सुरक्षा उपकरण और features नहीं है जैसे ESP, CSC, Traction control और hill road assit या roll over mitigation, VSM जो इस तरह की ऊँची गाड़ी के लिए बहुत ज़रूरी है और इनको बहुत ज़रूरी है!

ख़रीदने से पहले सोचे ये गाड़ी कितनी सुरक्षित है क्या ये भारतीय रोड के हिसाब से सुरक्षित है!!

इसी कारण से GNACP ये गाड़ी का टेस्ट नहीं हो रहा है !

अभी भी कुछ बेवक़ूफ़ शायद ये comments करेंगे कि आप GT लाइन ले लो मगर ये बताओ कि why comany create those unsafe models.

मेरा उद्देश्य किसी brand की image को बिगाड़ना नहीं अपितु रोड accident से बचना है इस unsafe car में आपकी family के साथ साथ मेरी फ़ैमिली भी unsafe है

Name: Sandeep Patil
Comment: @Chirumani Sai kalyan even i dont have any info on this.but roughly can provide an insight..these days TATA is having after sales service issues, this i learnt from YouTube reviews. the more the tech savy the car, the more the maintenance cost and service availability. maruti is preferred only because its service, spares, and better road side assistance. Kia,Nexon,Venue, XUV all are hitech machines and they can be serviced only in authorized service center.again the service issues depend on the area u stay.if there r good service centres in ur area, then both XUV and Nexon are good..but one thing for sure, one fuse blown and v have to run diagnostics on the scanner/computer that is available only in service center... consider this before u buy a hitech car. if any technical snag occurs while long journeys, sometimes its very very painful coz of no road side assistance and turnaround time to resolve issue. always read the service manuals and b familiar with it before you go on any journey..best luck 👍🏻

Name: Hare Haran
Comment: After test driving almost all the vehicles in the segment..purchased XUV 300 diesel amt..pretty much satisfied about the purchase. Overall vehicle build, ride quality and handling has been excellent. Best in class power and torque compared to its rivals. Ergonomically and visibility wise I felt it very good in this vehicle..No neck pain or back pain after 5-6 hours continuous long drive. I didn't feel good about head support in nexon. Another important thing is rear seating comfort, 3 people can comfortably sit in XUV 300..whereas others I found it difficult and best leg room is offered in this vehicle. Only let down in this vehicle what I feel is the boot space. I made that sacrifice as my priority was rear seating comfort over boot space. Steering modes in this vehicle was a standout thing..felt its importance especially when riding on highways, the steering becomes hard/heavy when you put it on sport mode offering better stability on highway. When driving in city you can have it in comfort mode, steering is as light as any other hyundai or a Honda electronic power steering.

Name: Hare Haran
Comment: @Adarsh Noolvi in highways i am getting 20kmpl, in city between 12.5 to 13.5kmpl, I have checked both tank to tank and the system one as well, both correlate eachother. When you compare this amt to  nexons amt..this is far far better. Nexon I get to feel lot of jerks, in this it is subtle you won't get to feel it very hard. You cannot completely avoid the Jerks while shifting, that's nature of any Amt transmission. XUV has refined AMT. Only you will feel the 1st to 2nd gear transmission little awkward in the auto mode..as it is designed in such a way that this transmission happens only when it reaches 2000 RPM,  shifting of  other gears 2nd and above is pretty smooth, you won't even feel any anything  while shifting. I usually shift 1st to 2nd gear in manual mode as it allows to do the shift 1000 RPM and then put it to auto mode for hassle free experience. Throttle response is amazing in this vehicle, when ever you need power the vehicle delivers it,  which isn't the case in most of the Amt. Overall drive quality and stability of vehicle on the highways is superb. I don't have any regrets on purchasing this vehicle except the slightly small boot space.

Name: Birthsquad Endless Road
Comment:
@Vini look I am not that of expert, but I can say xuv300 has better handling than nexon. Power delivery is so sweet in xuv300. 

Look i will help you, how i bought a car. 
I made few points which I require a car to have. 

These are mines:
1. Torque (coz i hill in hilly area) 
2. Decent ground clearance 
3. Pickup speed
4. Better second sit
5. Good looking 

That's all.... So xuv 300 fits for me in these points. 

If you have lots of luggage to carry then don't buy xuv300... But if your luggage is not problem than go for xuv300. 

Its better if you get diesel variant w4. Better mileage and 300 nm of Torque.

Comment: @Adityan r varier ❤️❤️

Name: Adityan r varier
Comment:
@Shashank Sharma soo true ...what everyone said about xuv 300 on this comnent session...i dnt know why its soo underrated..may be it cannot cop up with features by koreans ..but a car is not only features ..its a machine which is to be given priority..even mileage can be negotiated if engine is that good .

We were looking for a sub 4 m suv ...and had test driven sonet,venue ,brezza ..in venue due to poor back seat comfort we dropped it then itself .then it was brezza which was a good driveable car...driving felt pleasure but something felt missing(may be we strongly had a dezire to try another company than maruti suzuki,and sunroof was kinda mandatory for family members)
So dropped it too..then it was kia sonet..we almost fixed the car but our family members felt something lacking in rear seat ,even though it had ac vents ,rear charging ports, comfort was missing there ...seats were not that great,leg room okey but bad thigh support ....
Then accidentally we saw a test drive xuv300 vehicle ..done a test drive and woah🔥🔥🔥till then we didnt see the engine performance as a benchmark in selecting vehicles due to tendency towards features provided by kia,hyundai..but after xuv we undrrstood that kia and hyundai were laggy and underpowered .

So if you can spent 14lkhs
If bootspace is not a big deal
If you are not a mileage lover
If korean features do not attract you 

I strongly reccomend xuv300 for
That torqy engine
Best in class back seat comfort
Safety
Required essential features 
17inch alloys
All 4 discs

Name: Z Dsouza

Name: Shashank Sharma
Comment: Guys apart from this video ...i wana share my experience...when i wanted to buy a car especially compact suv...i blindly go for tata nexon for many reasons like budget issues and deshbhakti😎  by then only venue, brezza and xuv were in the market...i never considered brezza for its build and looking ..and xuv for over budget issue but my dream car was xuv at that time...i drove nexon, venue and then sonet..i felt issue in nexon especially the clutch ..travel was long and sometimes after pressing it took 3 to 4 seconds to come..so i drop the idea of buying nexon..then i drove venue and sonet..i was dissapointed with the engine performances of the two cars...then i went for xuv...when i took the test drive...ohh my god i was become fan of it...and booked on same day..never ever considered price...because i well know that car is a machine not a toy or phone in which u want only features...a true machine provides power and ride comfort..and one more thing luckly i saw all four cars on front together and i must say xuv and sonet was looking bulkier and good looking among all...so that was my experience ❤️

Name: rajoo solanky
Comment:
Comparison should also include Quality of After-Sales Services, availability of Spares, Labour & regular Services charges.
Purchasing a Car is the start of big relationship with the Co. for atleast 5 years. Trust on Reliability & Durability of Car is developed upon by this important aspect of After-Sales Services. And Tata Services fails in that department since I have suffered the worst as Tata Car owner. Tired of maintaining it for 5 years, got fed up finally sold it at Scrape value. Because of high maintenance cost Nobody is interested in buying used Tata cars That's the main reason Tata cars does not fetch good Resale value in Used car market.
Tata is yet to produce world class refined engines especially Petrol. Check Tata Cars Tiago, Tigor & Nexon Exports nos. datas for a clearer picture.
*Apart from Good looks & strong body shell your car should have refined, responsive & low NVH level Engine (Heart) alongwith well trained Service engineers (Doctors) & Service Stn (Multi-speciality Hospitals) to take care of the health of your Car for atleast 5 years. And Tata lacks in all 3 - Heart, Doctors & Hospitals. Think twice before you invest your hard earned money in Tata Cars since they offer the least warranty on major parts*

Name: Harsh Dave
Comment:
I have booked Tata Nexon XZ+ a few days back. Reasons for going with Tata Nexon 

1) Best in terms of safety. The build quality is very strong. Just look at some of the videos of Tata Nexon accident crashes and find out yourself. Jab jaan hi nahi rahegi toh features ka achaar daaloge kya.
2) Subtle interiors. I am more of a minimalist kind of person and don't like a lot of clutter. I felt that the interiors of tata Nexon are quite subtle and the lights looked classy at the night time.    
3) Drive modes for different driving conditions. You can select the mode depending on your needs. Whether you want more power or more mileage. 

4) Good music system. Harman is a recognized brand and the sound quality was at par with Bose music system which is in Sonet highest variant. 
5) Good space on the rear seat for 3 people to sit comfortably. The extra thigh support on Nexon's seats is very comfortable. 2 males and 1 female can sit without any discomfort but it can be slightly inconvenient for 3 males. The rear seating space on Kia was shocking for me. I currently own Hyundai Accent and trust me, the rear seat of Kia Sonet provides lesser space than my Accent. This was the reason why I didn't even consider buying Sonet. If after spending close to 10 lakhs, even 5 people cant sit inside the car comfortably, toh kya hi matlab hai car lene ka. 
6) High ground clearance - very useful on Indian roads
7) Sufficient boot space

Name: Mayur Mahindrakar
Comment:
@Harsh
Agree with most of your comments and not questioning your choice however questioning your sources of information.
If you are judging build quality based on youtube videos, trust me you're making a big mistake. None of the youtube videos show all facts of accidents and they are making videos for their advantage. Since TATA Nexon is famous on social media you'll find videos favouring Tata Nexon for more views. If you know any Youtubers personally talk to them. I personally have seen how data is manipulated. However Tata Nexon is really safe car not upto mark with XUV300 though because you can feel it when in car.
Spacewise again XUV300 is better than Nexon however you loose badly on boot space.
Ground clearance is enough for all cars considering indian roads because it is combination of ground clearance and suspension set up.
Sound quality in nexon is great however sonet has changed the game because the Bose set up in sonet is way ahead of everyone else (however it is in top trim).
The only issues with Nexon is it's life and maintenance because it's Tata Motors and i have experience with Tata so just sharing what is the fact. Long term life of Tata cars is certainly not preferred as you'll be starting to hear sounds from car after few years which are not assuring if you are in absolute love with your car else people drive even Tata sumo for many years.

Rest I'll say it's a great choice however service experience will matter in long term.
And of course it depends on your priorities with a car so good choice I'll say except not to be kept for longer duration with you.

Name: ꜱᴜᴍᴇᴅʜ ✪
Comment:
@Ady Pahuja 
BHP isn't horse power again, it's brake horse power.
You need to go back to 12th and learn the basic Power's formula first.
You've just googled about momentum and stuff.

Torque works against the force, bhp works towards the force.
In short, bhp is useful when you're at higher speeds. Car will accelerate faster then.
At lower to medium engine speeds, Torque is more crucial. Hence you feel the pull, at the lower Rpms.
You can cruise easily without changing gears.

So higher bhp will result in a faster car.
But at the initial and mid engine revving stage, car with more torque will surpass the car with higher bhp.
As higher bhp cars have late red lines and high rpm swings to reach the optimum speeds, generally petrol cars.

So currently in market all the petrol cars you see have very low torque when compared to diesel cars.
So less mileage, nor are they faster than Diesel variants.
But in racing world, cars are designed keeping bhp and Torque in comparable proportions.
And petrol is more preferred as it burns more nicely & quickly.

Cheers

Name: Alankar Das
Comment:
Hi Rachit ! 
Thanks for the review....that was really awesome 👍
One important thing that you missed or I can say you keep missing is that whenever you test an Automatic car it's very important to emphasize that most of the variants of that particular car is having a Hill Assist Control (HAC) or not. 
I have observed that you test the Automatic cars on almost flat surfaces rather than on a really steep climb like Hill driving or even the exit of a Mall Parking. This feature is really very important because if someone buys Venue iMT (except the top model) or Sonet iMT, the company is not providing the  HAC feature. I believe Sonet has this feature in DCT variant which is quite expensive and most of the people won't opt for it.
It's a request, kindly do highlight the importance of having the HAC while giving reviews of an Automatic car. 
This will be good and also an eye opener for all those buyers who are not aware how much importance this feature holds while buying an Automatic car. 
A lay man will always think that the car he/she will be buying is an Automatic version so it will never roll backwards because of the creep function that the car offers . But at the same time it's also important to know and understand that the creep feature only works properly on a flat surface and won't prevent the car from rolling backwards if you stop midway and then try to accelerate while driving against a steep climb.
Thank you !

Name: Saurabh Sood
Comment:
@motoroctane Since Kia Sonet diesel automatic costs nearly same as the base Tata Harrier Automatic,
Please make a comparison of both.
It is interesting to note that all those who want space at this price range can also opt for the Mahindra Marrazzo which is larger than all of these.
You must compare Kia Sonet  diesel with Marrazzo Diesel manual since they fall in similar price bracket.
Spend your hard earned money after checking out the Marrazzo Diesel and the Tata Harrier.
An extra Lakh spent while buying the car 🚗 is justified
Rather than regretting later for the decision.
Journey is comfortable with space and suspension and air-conditioning.
Marrazzo Diesel is having the best air-conditioning, space and comfort as compared to the small sub 4 m Sonet. Also Excellent braking and bigger tyres.
The features will be forgotten and unused after the first few days.
However when you travel and you are pressed for space,
The comfort goes out of the window.

Name: Yogesh Rao
Comment:
Sonet & Venue : Poor Ride quality,poor Handling & dynamics, poor Rear seat space, poor visibility in Sonet, Good transmission, blah blah un-necessary features which goes bad will cost the owner in a just a few years, probably korean cars look bettter for some.

Nexon : Nexon has good ride quality, handling & dynamics & good rear seat space, Offers top line safety features from base variant and has a 5 star safety rating, poor transmission and features come at a premium.

XUV 300 : Decent in everything Nexon is at but comes at a premium also transmission is not great as well, the mileage is worst but performance is best in the segment.

Nexon looks the best bet from VFM point of view, Sonet is close 2nd, Xuv 300 is for enthusiast for whom 0.1 sec better pickup matters, Venue is for people who want a mix of topline features and good transmission at lower cost. Sonet has many forms, it offers everything but not great in any of them apart from features

Name: Poojan Raval
Comment: ​@kite ​ @Jatt rx  May be you own Nexon so u are so much into nexon, Listen my friend. There are many things to consider, Nexon is good as well but rear seat capacity is better in xuv, handling is better in xuv, power is more in xuv, features are more in xuv though most of not useful, Nexon on other hand has more bootspace and music system is top in nexon, ground clearance is best in nexon, but none of us will drive our cars on rivers and stuffs, 180 mm is sufficient on daily uses on highway and cities and bad roads, Xuv bootspace i would say it has enuf bootspace to keep small 4 or 5 small trolleybags, and i dont think we always need so much boot space hardly we use full bootspace once in a year or twice, Xuv doesnt have rear ac vents but ac is powerful to cool rear fast too. Mileage is lower than nexon so the power is high. Both has 5 Star ncap rating and both are international models, seating cusioning is better in nexon. and now top model price of nexon is higher than top model xuv as well. So consider these points then decide which car is good.. i own none of them. I am planning.. Rather than buying fancy stuffs we should look how many people can sit comfortably. I would say xuv300 has enuf space at rear for 3 people to seat comfortably, i dont need that much bootspace so i am ok with bootspace. handling is better than all of these 3 cars. power is good too.. Everything is good apart from that shitty central consol ac wheel and buttons which looks so cheap. i dont need Auto Dimming IRVM, Auto HeadLamps, Wireless Charger, Auto Headlight, Sun Roof, Dual zone ac, Rain sensing wipers, mood lights and stuffs, These Features are useless in Indian Lifestlye and weather. So be Practical and choose wisely.
